New Records: Luis Gil pitched six innings and recorded his first career save in the ninth inning.
Aaron Judge extended his season-long streak of games without a home run to 10.
The Yankees scored three runs in the third inning, their highest single-inning output this season.
Key Match Events: The Yankees scored all three of their runs in the third inning, which was a turning point in the game.
The Cubs managed only one hit, a double by Cody Bellinger, in the entire game.
Luis Gil's return from a back injury and his strong performance were significant.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees were on a six-game road trip and trailing the AL East-leading Baltimore Orioles by half a game before the game.
Anthony Rizzo received a warm reception from the Wrigley Field crowd in his first game there since being traded to the Yankees in 2021.
Post-Match Reflections: Chicago Cubs manager Craig Counsell criticized his team's performance, noting they left runners on base and struggled to score.
New York Yankees manager Aaron Boone praised Gil's pitching performance and the team's overall effort.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game marked the Yankees' first shutout since August 23 and their second win in four games since returning from a challenging series in Texas.
The Cubs were attempting to maintain their position in the NL wild-card race, but their performance did not help their cause.
